column11: One possible approach to versioning is to use digits such that the first digit (e.g. 1.0) represents a major corpus update (adding new data, new annotations, etc.) and the second digit represents a minor update (corrections of annotations). If relevant, a  third digit can be added for changes in documentation etc. (but only in cases where data has not been changed).
